lines.text: The idea of working in your shirt sleeves! Think of the shock to your customers _ women of culture and refinement.
I'll be at the next floor up, just as soon as I am through ditching the cop.

[feeling exasperated with Bill for the delay and scared from the height and exhausted from his having to keep climbing up one floor-level after another]
You BE THERE - - or I will be THROUGH!
Oh, pal _ She's just got to believe that I'm successful _ until I am.
Mr. Stubbs _ Head Floorwalker. Muscle-bound _ From patting himself on the back _
If it ain't Jim Taylor of Great Bend! You o-l-d rascal! How you have got on in the world -...
Don't you think it's dangerous for a young man to be alone in the city, with so much money? -...

[Pretending to be the General Manager]
STUBBS. - - I don't wish to be annoyed by any more of your petty complaints about personal appearance - - You know, you're no collar ad, yourself.
Say, for five hundred dollars I'd climb to Heaven, an' hang by my heels from the pearly gates.
Young man, don't you know you might fall and get hurt?
Make this next floor faster. I'm having a little difficulty in ditching the cop.
